    • Constructor Detail

      • ConditionalData

        public ConditionalData(java.util.Properties props,
                       java.util.ArrayList<com.novell.nidp.common.authority.UserAuthority> stores)
        Instantiate the ConditionalData authentication class.
        The IDP executes the constructor in two ways:
        • after applying the configuration (this is for checking the input, lacking dynamic properties)
        • at authentication time (with specific dynamic properties) at which point the rulecache is finalized
        Parameters:
        props - the Properties object for this class, will contain strings and objects (!)
        stores - the list of user stores

    • Method Detail

      • createHashValue

        private java.lang.String createHashValue(java.lang.String input)
        Create the hexadecimal string representation of a SHA-256 hash value from the given input String.
        Parameters:
        input - String value
        Returns:
        hexadecimal String of the hash

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Return the authentication type of this class.
        Overrides:
        getType in class com.novell.nidp.authentication.local.LocalAuthenticationClass
        Returns:
        String value from AuthnConstants

      • doAuthenticate

        protected int doAuthenticate()
        implement doAuthenticate() in the following way:
        get principal's source attributes, process rules across principal's attributes, write results to destination attributes
        Overrides:
        doAuthenticate in class com.novell.nidp.authentication.local.LocalAuthenticationClass
        Returns:
        returns the status of the authentication process which is always AUTHENTICATED.
        Also saves data into the IDP LDAP cache.

      • updateRequiredData

        private void updateRequiredData(DataRequest req,
                                DataResponse resp,
                                BusinessRule rule,
                                java.lang.String[] values)
        Find out if the current ruleset requires the rule destination attribute.
        If so, add to the DataResponse object for further processing.
        Parameters:
        req - the original datarequest from the ruleset
        resp - the dataresponse to update
        rule - the rule whose results to add
        values - the result values

        private DataResponse getRequiredData(DataRequest data)
